summary.p: The Nested Loops operator performs the cross join, inner join, left outer join, left semi join, and left anti semi join logical operations.
Nested loops joins perform a search on the inner table for each row of the outer table.
Any rows that satisfy the (optional) predicate in the Predicate property are returned as applicable, based on the logical operation being performed.
Nested Loops is a physical operator.

tr.td: Specfies whether the Nested Loops operators performs an inner join, left outer join, left semi join, or left anti semi join logical operation.
Specifies which values from the outer input are to be passed to the inner input as parameters.

Indicates whether the outer input is actually to be joined with the inner input. If this property is set, the join is not actually performed. Instead, all rows from the outer input are returned and the probe column is set to a BOOLEAN value indicating whether it had matches with the inner input. For example, using an EXISTS predicate directly in the select list of a SELECT statement causes this property to be set.

Specifies a predicate that, if evaluted to TRUE, does not perform the join operation. In this case, the Nested Loop operator just passes the outer row without reading any row from the inner input. The columns from the inner side are padded with NULL values.
If present, contains a warning such as an absence of the join predicate and outer reference. In this case it is likely that a cross join is created accidentally.
